item.title: Setting up Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) Application Load Balancers using LocalStack, deployed via the Serverless framework
item.description: Elastic Load Balancer (ELB) is a service that distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as EC2 instances, containers, IP addresses, and Lambda functions. ELBs can be physical hardware or virtual software components. They accept incoming traffic and distribute it across multiple targets in one or more Availability Zones. Using ELB, you can quickly scale your load balancer to accommodate changes in traffic over time, ensuring optimal performance for your application and workloads running on the AWS infrastructure.
